# The Best Wireless Headphones for Everyone

We found a bunch of headphones and earbuds that sound like a million bucks,
even if you're on a budget.

  * [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dialog/feed?&display=popup&caption=WIRED's%20Absolute%20Favorite%20Wireless%20Headphones%20and%20Earbuds&app_id=719405864858490&link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Fgallery%2Fbest-wireless-headphones%3Futm_source%3Dfacebook%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Donsite-share%26utm_brand%3Dwired%26utm_social-type%3Dearned)
  * [Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Fgallery%2Fbest-wireless-headphones%3Futm_source%3Dtwitter%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Donsite-share%26utm_brand%3Dwired%26utm_social-type%3Dearned&text=WIRED's%20Absolute%20Favorite%20Wireless%20Headphones%20and%20Earbuds&via=wired)
  * [Email](mailto:?subject=WIRED's%20Absolute%20Favorite%20Wireless%20Headphones%20and%20Earbuds&body=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Fgallery%2Fbest-wireless-headphones%3Futm_source%3Donsite-share%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Donsite-share%26utm_brand%3Dwired)

  * [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dialog/feed?&display=popup&caption=WIRED's%20Absolute%20Favorite%20Wireless%20Headphones%20and%20Earbuds&app_id=719405864858490&link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Fgallery%2Fbest-wireless-headphones%3Futm_source%3Dfacebook%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Donsite-share%26utm_brand%3Dwired%26utm_social-type%3Dearned)
  * [Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Fgallery%2Fbest-wireless-headphones%3Futm_source%3Dtwitter%26utm_medium%3Dsocial%26utm_campaign%3Donsite-share%26utm_brand%3Dwired%26utm_social-type%3Dearned&text=WIRED's%20Absolute%20Favorite%20Wireless%20Headphones%20and%20Earbuds&via=wired)
  * [Email](mailto:?subject=WIRED's%20Absolute%20Favorite%20Wireless%20Headphones%20and%20Earbuds&body=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wired.com%2Fgallery%2Fbest-wireless-headphones%3Futm_source%3Donsite-share%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Donsite-share%26utm_brand%3Dwired)

Whether you're listening to the latest episode of the [Gadget Lab
Podcast](https://www.wired.com/tag/podcasts/) or hitting the treadmill with
your favorite Taylor Swift album in tow, the right pair of wireless headphones
can make or break your day. Problem is, there are a lot to choose from.

WIRED's Gear team is constantly trying out new models, to help those of us
that are tired of using a dongle. These are our top picks for the best
wireless headphones and why you might be interested in each pair.

Be sure to check out our other audio guides for the [best wirefree
earbuds](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-wirefree-earbuds/), [best workout
earbuds](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-wireless-workout-headphones/),
[best smart speakers](https://www.wired.com/story/best-smart-speakers/), and
[best Bluetooth speakers](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-bluetooth-
speakers/) if you're searching for other kinds of audio nirvana.

 _Updated in May 2020: We've revamped this guide with a bunch of new
headphones, including the JLab Go Air, Beats Powerbeats, and Jabra Elite
Active 75T._

If you buy something using links in our stories, we may earn a commission.
[Learn more](https://www.wired.com/2015/11/affiliate-link-policy/).

  * ![sony wh1000mx3 headphones](https://media.wired.com/photos/5b9c4ec41ab9432d39626709/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Sony-WH1000XM3-headphones-SOURCE-Sony.jpg)

Photograph: Sony

## Best Overall Headphones

Sony WH1000XM3

Which is better: Bose or Sony? For now, [we're giving the edge to
Sony](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-noise-canceling-headphones/) for
noise-canceling and audio quality. The [WH1000XM3 (8/10, WIRED
Recommends)](https://www.wired.com/review/review-sony-wh1000xm3-headphones/)
sound absolutely vibrant and last up to 30 hours on a charge (that's 10 hours
longer than Bose cans). Their noise-canceling is on par with Bose and better
than everything else on the market. The touch controls aren't perfect, but the
ability to put your hand over the right earcup to hear outside noise is super
handy.

The only annoying issue is call quality. The XM3 are poor at phone calls.
You'll sound like you're down the hallway to folks on the other line. (The
older [Sony 1000XM2](https://www.amazon.com/Sony-Noise-Cancelling-Headphones-
WH1000XM2/dp/B074KDJVS2/) are also superb, but not worth it unless you get a
good discount.)

[$348 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxiDU8JuRu6YmaDxnyNKpyVrTPGpVgEFg6U2vZvr2d9tR57M4ZpkbvWqYy8Pnd5sWs2?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$350 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxiDU8JuRu6YmaDxnyNKpyVrTPGpVgEFg6U2wzARpo4CxqP7sK1rrX7pFJY6a4eCzb6?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![1More stylish headphones](https://media.wired.com/photos/5d4dac413c3a1d0008e09af0/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/1More-Stylish-True-Wireless-SOURCE-1More.jpg)

Photograph: 1More

## Best Overall Wirefree Earbuds

1More Stylish True Wireless

From tiny tots to stubborn geriatrics, I’ve yet to find a person who doesn’t
like the way these rubberized wirefree earbuds fit their ears. Three sizes of
silicone eartips and comfortable earfins help them stay secure in almost any
ears.

The Stylish also sound great, with the AptX-enabled buds offering punchy bass
that’s impressive for headphones this size. Such comfort, sound quality, and
an Apple AirPod–beating 6.5 hours of battery life (at a price tag that’s $60
cheaper) make the 1More Stylish [the best wirefree earbuds you can
buy](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-wirefree-earbuds/) right now.

[$100 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnRU1Rwr1dW2FfkvgCNR7xPCJw5DuLBgbqwn3Lhi9tsRoyTNnzYzz59BXNL8nfXVg3?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$100 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnRU1Rwr1dW2FfkvgCNR7xPCJw5DuLBgbqwoTXU5EXPUd54m8VM76RBboEtujszt29?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![](https://media.wired.com/photos/5e8fc019ca6a5100098746dc/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-Beats-Powerbeats-Colors-SOURCE-Beats.jpg)

Photograph: Beats

## Best Workout Earbuds

Beats Powerbeats (2020)

AirPods are easy to use with iPhone, but they’re not all that great when it
comes to battery life or sweatproof performance. Our [favorite pair of workout
headphones](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-wireless-workout-headphones/)
are actually the Beats Powerbeats ([8/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/beats-powerbeats-2020/)).

The earclip-style buds stay attached during workouts, with a wire behind the
head that keeps you from losing one, and lets you hang them around your neck
when you're not listening. They look and function identically to the more-
expensive Powerbeats Pro ([8/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/beats-powerbeats-pro/)), but the
cable means you get 15 hours of battery life to the Pros' 9 hours, and saves
you about $100 bucks.

[$150 at
Apple](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpbGt1T9Q8FnWi9urieqWqwFMQud3sULgsA4dVaczTF5cTp9vgoWdRTvenqAPwxd6x?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$150 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpbGt1T9Q8FnWi9urieqWqwFMQud3sULgsA4S6MwG1M35HJKv78msP1Z9sNxD6xqHk?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$150 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpbGt1T9Q8FnWi9urieqWqwFMQud3sULgsA4dVaczdY7ncZdomYk4q8bMnLe42Xs5M?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * 

  * ![bose noise cancelling 700](https://media.wired.com/photos/5da7a8f8a30cfa0008c53267/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Bose-Noise-Cancelling-700-SOURCE-Bose.jpg)

Photograph: Bose

## Best for Phone Calls

Bose Noise Cancelling 700

Special digital signal processing (DSP) and an advanced microphone array
inside Bose’s latest flagship headphones allow them to limit background noise
and focus on your voice alone, making them the best headphones you can buy
when it comes to call quality. Plus, the special mics and DSP pair with Bose’s
incredibly effective noise-canceling tech, making it seem like you’re in a
quiet space even when you’re out and about.

Couple all of that with great comfort, noise-canceling, battery life, and
sound quality, and the Bose 700 are among the best headphones for a
businessperson right now.

[$399 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2FRf6vNcCujnD2MdnEyiDoFBhBCxiJ9LshcqVbeYkXSj7miY7dUPW1nJe6oXi?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$399 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2FRf6vNcCujnD2MdnEyiDoFBhBCxiJAYdbpkaaSMYkbYQ58t5b7NWk3tbJuhk?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![sennheiser momentum 3](https://media.wired.com/photos/5da7a962f348560008125f1c/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Sennheiser-Momentum-3-SOURCE-Sennheiser.jpg)

Photograph: Sennheiser

## Best Sound Quality

Sennheiser Momentum 3 Wireless

You won’t get the same tippy-top-level quality noise-canceling or battery life
as you will from the two top Sony or Bose headphones on our list, but the
third generation of Sennheiser’s Momentum Wireless still silences a lot of
noise and are a tour-de-force when it comes to sound quality and design.

The posh over-ears are reminiscent of studio headphones from the rock and roll
era, with robust stainless steel and plush leather earpads that stay
comfortable for hours on end. Sennheiser's excellent in-house tuning will
sometimes make you think you’re listening to remixes of your favorite records
with more detail added in. Their low-end bass is bold—but not overwhelming—and
it joins a hyper-detailed middle and high range, painting your favorite tunes
in vibrant musical color. The added noise-canceling serves the music in the
same way a white wall serves art in a gallery.

[ ~~$400~~ $350 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2FguTkX11RkvrHB3bEuypNszzUqooVewUCxr5gUzrQxizfsNKVsaFsvFVPeXs?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$400 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2FguTkX11RkvrHB3bEuypNszzUqooVg9E7Am2N6tkxvdehS1vNtTnq2UrHpua?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![sennheiser 4.40 BT](https://media.wired.com/photos/5c05db68d5a8c02cd43f9f45/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Sennheiser-4-4BT-side-SOURCE-Sennheiser.jpg)

Photograph: Sennheiser

## Best Headphones for $100 or Less

Sennheiser HD 4.40 BT

Don't let the drab design fool you. These Sennheisers ([7/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/review-sennheiser-hd-44-bt/)) sound
killer and last 25 hours on a charge. They also produce powerful but not
overpowering bass and have an app that lets you tinker with EQ settings. Near
Field Communication (NFC) makes Bluetooth pairing as easy as holding up your
phone, and the buttons on the earcups make changing songs and adjusting volume
straightforward tasks.

If you want noise cancelling, the [fancier Sennheiser
BT4.5](https://www.amazon.com/Sennheiser-HD-4-50-Headphones-
Cancellation/dp/B01MSZSL4I?tag=w050b-20) might be up your alley.

[$85 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxgRpewsqJLhXkHD8trH8ZWGVXuKMPdHepoGdWbvbaTeThp1Nx9jkYruDgPjzoMJBJG?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$100 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxgRpewsqJLhXkHD8trH8ZWGVXuKMPdHepoGevqWPmD7itrcxx1NMT8jcCuNHyfdi1W?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![Taotronics noise cancelling headphones in black](https://media.wired.com/photos/5da7aa7d08f850000871919b/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Taotronics-Noise-Cancelling-Headphones-SOURCE-Taotronics.jpg)

Photograph: Taotronics

## Best Headphones for $50 or Less

Taotronics Active Noise Cancelling Headphones

If you’re looking for a decent pair of over-ear headphones with great sound
and battery life, try this model from Chinese brand TaoTronics. They are a
perfect travel companion, with 45 hours of battery life and decent noise
reduction (though not the whisper silence you’d expect from the Sony and Bose
models, which cost hundreds of dollars more). And unlike some of the more
expensive models, you won't have to worry as much about breaking or losing
them.

[$50 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2G2HAXPxwfDhhHrnY64hd9oaUEA5FRUASUTV3JAxZ7wpzAV7uyJpMzhXzNcZZ?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![sony wf1000xm3 earbuds](https://media.wired.com/photos/5d37734e40f5e50008feb41f/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-Sony-Earbuds-WF-1000XM3_B_case3-Mid.jpg)

Photograph: Sony

## Best Noise-Canceling Buds

Sony WF-1000XM3

Toting around a big pair of over-ear headphones used to be the only way to
effectively drown out the world, but no more. With its WF-1000XM3 ([9/10,
WIRED Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/sony-wf-1000xm3/)), Sony took a
shrink ray to the same noise-canceling tech we loved inside its over-ear
WH-1000XM3 model. These wirefree earbuds have six hours of battery life,
making them great for all but the longest outdoor adventures, and a fast
10-minute charge in the case will nab you an extra hour and a half of juice
for when you forget to charge them.

Couple these features with Sony's outstanding [DSEE
HX](https://www.sony.co.uk/electronics/support/articles/00230269) audio
processing, and you're left with some of the best-sounding and most capable
buds around.

[ ~~$228~~ $198 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnQz417VGVCmdJGQDV4eQEAjYLyewTso5Ti7E3mQQ11CDDdxA9xj2kF7xBJpkZFEvH?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[ ~~$230~~ $198 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnQz417VGVCmdJGQDV4eQEAjYLyewTso5Ti8eWGizckxUkw7HnUBryXFeqUdNqTfPn?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![master  dynamic mw07GOSG](https://media.wired.com/photos/5db338955b8c9000084c7c22/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Master-Dynamic-Earbuds-MW07GOSG_FitWing.jpg)

Photograph: Master & Dynamic

## Best Workout Buds for Audiophiles

Master & Dynamic MW07 Go

Master & Dynamic's MW07 Go ([9/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/master-and-dynamic-mw07-go/)) are
light, comfortable, and compact, but still sound fantastic, which is why
they're now my go-to buds at the gym. They have a more vibrant soundstage and
much more musical detail than most wirefree models, they last for 10 hours per
charge, and they have an IPX6 rating, so you can confidently rinse them off
after your bi-weekly trip on the treadmill.

Plus, I like the physical buttons on top of each headphone, which never gets
jostled when you adjust the earbuds during workouts—unlike pesky touch
controls.

[ ~~$200~~ $145 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnp29Swese2ixRxmyeE8wUM4AFtsnYCV3gm8f1CHryJL58e5kK6cq9kmGpRoXBJB7S?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$199 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnp29Swese2ixRxmyeE8wUM4AFtsnYCV3gm7UYzdzcDt9BYaoEtzrfP7esGXsxuPQU?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$199 at Master &
Dynamic](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnp29Swese2ixRxmyeE8wUM4AFtsnYCV3gm7TX6tKvrUCXyC3PArkQ3HgG4gUU5yyu?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![earbuds ](https://media.wired.com/photos/5e9faa0fd42e6f0008f47b81/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-JLab-Go-Air-Buds-Alone-SOURCE-JLab-Audio.jpg)

Photograph: JLab Audio

## Best Super Cheap Earbuds

JLab Audio Go Air

For a super budget pick, we like these wirefree earbuds ([8/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/jlab-go-air-review/)). They only get
five hours of battery life per charge and their case (which holds about four
extra charges) has an open-topped design that can collect a bit of junk in
your pockets, but they're great cheap headphones. They are small and
comfortable in your ears, and they sound good enough for the price. They're
also IP44 rated, so you can sweat in them without worry. The case even has a
built-in USB cable, so you don't need to tote extra cords with you.

Check out [our other favorite cheap
headphones](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-headphones-under-100/), if
you're on a budget.

[$30 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpbfcozRtnUwp4eESJLQAYnxipP269dYbMi4VADwU5VNAeF1aa7bFchjnTWrQnGS82?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$30 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpbfcozRtnUwp4eESJLQAYnxipP269dYbMi4gHdQHS2BL29FBRbmHGg2iYC4kYhDvt?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![airpods pro](https://media.wired.com/photos/5db74a73c96358000859e622/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/TechTwo-Apple_AirPods-Pro_New-Design-case-and-airpods-pro_102819.jpg)

Photograph: Apple

## Best for iPhone Owners (And Silence Lovers)

Apple AirPods Pro

The AirPods Pro ([8/10, WIRED Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/apple-
airpods-pro/)) are easily worth the $100 premium you'll pay over [standard
AirPods](https://www.wired.com/review/apple-airpods-2019/). For one thing,
they're much more comfortable and secure—thanks to silicone eartips that
replace the standard AirPods' hard plastic. They also sound much better. The
eartips create a better seal with your ears for more dynamic bass response. We
also love active noise canceling. You'll never hear your kids squealing in the
next room while you're trying to get some work done.

You won't get that same "plugged-ear" feeling you get with other in-ears
thanks to built-in vents, and an IPX4 rating makes them great at the gym. My
only gripe? Battery life, which stands at a paltry 4.5 hours (outside of the
19.5-hour charging case).

[ ~~$249~~ $234 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnpWKmhBgaTxbA9DaE8ios8qHmnneDJi2Dfzoerb3u7ShsX6ix1ZZfFtNZgFDJueru?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$249 at
Apple](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnpWKmhBgaTxbA9DaE8ios8qHmnneDJi2DfzoS4fydYj1Lod4PjfFqwj9cB3M5TujE?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![earbuds ](https://media.wired.com/photos/5e4eedd2efbb670008f8c3a4/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-Jabra-Elite-Active-75t-SOURCE-Jabra.jpg)

Photograph: Jabra

## Most Rugged

Jabra Elite Active 75T

The Elite Active 75T are the perfect earbuds for people who can't stop
breaking their phone screens. They're tiny and ergonomic, so you won't drop
one on the street during a jog, and they've got an IP57 rating, which means
you can drop them in the sink or the dirt without any problems. They're also
great-sounding headphones, with great 7.5-hour battery life outside the case,
and some of the best call quality around. Do your worst, they'll keep on
ticking.

[$200 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpZLwcjUWxf1DvDJ5gzgM9pyNFFbztaRUG3QAAa4AFKfbFYLPSCQzwQrnd476yWK3K?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$200 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpZLwcjUWxf1DvDJ5gzgM9pyNFFbztaRUG3QNbofaVQViix6bURraVtDmYE8cazotP?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![master  dynamic hp4x3 headphones](https://media.wired.com/photos/5da74aca182de80009f7fd73/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/MDHeadphones_HP-4x3.jpg)

Photograph: Master & Dynamic

## Best On-Ear Headphones

Master & Dynamic MW50+

If you prefer to have your headphones sit on your ears, not over and around
them, the MW50+ ([9/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/2016/12/review-master-dynamic-mw50/)) are
some of the classiest cans you can find. They're padded with ridiculously soft
lambskin and built around a metal frame with high-quality [40mm beryllium
drivers](https://blog.masterdynamic.com/article/know-your-sound-tool-
beryllium-drivers/). With 14+ hours on a charge and a two-year warranty,
they're worth a serious look if you're seeking a premium audio experience.

[ ~~$349~~ $225 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAwDMHezz8ziBSkiZkPoE8FtxwrB9DEiXdRJPw785HM33QBW7KGgzHCTFnNQqpMfnyMc?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[ ~~$350~~ $225 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAwDMHezz8ziBSkiZkPoE8FtxwrB9DEiXdRJPxXMf5XJc7oCjZEQmnEceuU1dNjw8CfP?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![audio technica ath m50xBT](https://media.wired.com/photos/5da7a9d0a30cfa0008c53269/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Audio-Technica-ATH-M50xBT-SOURCE-Audio-Technica.jpg)

Photograph: Audio Technica

## Best for Producing Audio

Audio-Technica ATH-M50xBT

Audio Technica’s ATH-M50X ([9/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/2015/07/review-audio-technica-ath-m50x/))
headphones are known for balanced sound and great durability. It's made them
ubiquitous in music and film studios around the globe.

But what if you want to take them with you between takes? Enter the M50XBT,
which brings wireless technology to the beloved workhorse headphones for just
$20 extra. Don’t worry, wire lovers, the Bluetooth version comes with the same
coiled studio cable as the original corded version, so you can easily plug in
for a fresh take when you get back to the studio.

[$179 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2Fh97YyAFRVSe8QmQ7GeLhGiVLaLGz9XUTiu3GHsYLgFm4iEsH1NhB66zUQ4X?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$180 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2Fh97YyAFRVSe8QmQ7GeLhGiVLaLGzAjEMvpNw8tqPNPZJv3xPJkdE4vBX59Z?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

  * ![urbanears pampas headphones in dark forest green color](https://media.wired.com/photos/5da7aac8dc63930009eeffa3/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Urbanears-Pampas-SOURCE-Urbanears.jpg)

Photograph: Urbanears

## For Fans of Color

Urbanears Pampas

The Urbanears Pampas showcase classic Scandinavian minimalism, with a single
joystick-like control mechanism to change songs, play and pause music, and
adjust volume. They also come in several colors.

The bass-forward headphones aren't the absolute best sounding pair you'll find
for under $150, but their excellent looks—and fantastic 30 hours of listening
time—make them a great choice if you value form as highly as functionality.
These fabric-and-leatherette-lined cans should last you many years of solid
use.

[$128 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYdEUuJXKD9DuH5A5Lh4nCpsD4mWEz5sgygwmD5K5JLqEXZBkVMFMDA8g3aiNsHR?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)

[$150 at

Photograph: JLab Audio

## Best Headphones for Kids

JLab Audio JBuddies Studio Bluetooth

These compact Bluetooth headphones limit the volume to your kiddos’ ears,
keeping all sound below 85 decibels—the physician recommended limit for
extended listening without hearing damage. They get 13 hours of listening time
and have a durable design with pinch-less hinges to survive whatever kids can
throw at them. The grey, blue, and purple colors also make it easier to tell
whose pair is whose if you have multiple children. Plus, at just $30, they
don't break the bank.

Read our guide for [more kid-friendly travel
gear](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-travel-gear-for-kids/).

[$30 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnoYH2FkjgiBVgzbtzN2Q9VoPbReKfhAQhb9B8kquoErcE82KiR53LrNoV3ZXMX2iP?cid=5b8ff23f828b792d4e4b50f0)
